page.title: 10A FARMER
page.content: The family have owned 4 farms in the North East since 1885 and is known by all inhabitants of Brandon. Beef cattle and Suffolk cross fat lambs are bred to be sold in Newcastle. 50% of arable land is grassland to feed animal stock and 50% is for crops. 80% of wheat is sold to Spillers, Newcastle for baking;"feed" wheat(20%) is used for fattening animals. Barley is sold for malting, but if it is not good enough then it is used for animal feed. Oil seed rape, used in Britain due to E.E.C. encouragement, produces vegetable oil. It is a bright yellow crop, flowering in early June and Mr. Harle regards it as a good crop because it does not take many nutrients from the soil. Winter oats and swedes fatten the animals and some potatoes are sold locally.
